properties.name: options
properties.description: Index of the row which contains the keys. Starts at 1. The incoming node data is matched to the keys for assignment. The matching is case sensitive.

options.name: locationDefine
options.description: Index of the row which contains the keys. Starts at 1. The incoming node data is matched to the keys for assignment. The matching is case sensitive.

values.name: headerRow
values.description: Index of the row which contains the keys. Starts at 1. The incoming node data is matched to the keys for assignment. The matching is case sensitive.

properties.description: What to clear

properties.name: startIndex
properties.description: The row number to delete from, The first row is 1

properties.name: startIndex
properties.description: The column to delete

properties.name: range
properties.description: The table range to read from or to append data to. See the Google documentation for the details. If it contains multiple sheets it can also be added like this: "MySheet!A:F"

properties.name: title
properties.description: The name of the sheet

properties.name: options
properties.description: Whether the sheet is hidden in the UI, false if it's visible

options.name: hidden
options.description: Whether the sheet is hidden in the UI, false if it's visible

options.name: rightToLeft
options.description: Whether the sheet is an RTL sheet instead of an LTR sheet

options.name: sheetId
options.description: The ID of the sheet. Must be non-negative. This field cannot be changed once set.

options.name: index
options.description: The index of the sheet within the spreadsheet

options.name: tabColor
options.description: The color of the tab in the UI

properties.name: toDelete
properties.description: Rows to delete

properties.name: options
properties.description: Whether to select the first row of the sheet or the first matching row (if filters are set)

options.name: returnAllMatches
options.description: Return only the first match

options.name: Return All Matches
options.description: Return all values that match

properties.name: options
properties.description:
The locale of the spreadsheet in one of the following formats:
  • en (639-1)
  • fil (639-2 if no 639-1 format exists)
  • en_US (combination of ISO language an country)

options.name: locale
options.description:
The locale of the spreadsheet in one of the following formats:
  • en (639-1)
  • fil (639-2 if no 639-1 format exists)
  • en_US (combination of ISO language an country)

options.description: Volatile functions are updated on every change and every minute

options.name: Hour
options.description: Volatile functions are updated on every change and hourly

hints.text: Used to find the correct row to update. Doesn't get changed.
Used to find the correct row to update. Doesn't get changed.

notes.name: Notes
notes.description: Optional note to save with the node

notesInFlow.name: Display Note in Flow?
notesInFlow.description: If active, the note above will display in the flow as a subtitle

alwaysOutputData.name: Always Output Data
alwaysOutputData.description: If active, will output a single, empty item when the output would have been empty. Use to prevent the workflow finishing on this node

executeOnce.name: Execute Once
executeOnce.description: If active, the node executes only once, with data from the first item it receives

retryOnFail.name: Retry On Fail
retryOnFail.description: If active, the node tries to execute again when it fails

maxTries.name: Max. Tries
maxTries.description: Number of times to attempt to execute the node before failing the execution

waitBetweenTries.name: Wait Between Tries (ms)
waitBetweenTries.description: How long to wait between each attempt (in milliseconds)

onError.name: On Error
onError.description: Action to take when the node execution fails

options.name: Stop Workflow
options.description: Halt execution and fail workflow

options.name: Continue
options.description: Pass error message as item in regular output

options.name: Continue (using error output)
options.description: Pass item to an extra `error` output

settings.note: Executable nodes have both common and executable settings
